p.k: Brooklyn Vibes documents artists like Charles Bradley, Justine D, and Nicky Fingaz who are part of the thriving Brooklyn creative scene. The famous New York borough is a melting pot for talent.
p.d: Brooklyn Vibes documents artists who are part of the thriving Brooklyn creative scene. The famous New York borough is a melting pot for talent, which includes soul singer Charles Bradley, 62, who's musical success came later in life. Before joining the record company Job Corps, he was homeless. Another musician, Justine D, who is a DJ at night and baker during the day, also embodies the overall atmosphere of Brooklyn. The documentary also features Nicky Fingaz, a 16-year-old student at the Brooklyn High School of the Arts, a singer and guitar player who loves the creative energy in Williamsburg's neighbourhood of Brooklyn.
